Number of pixel rows

Space used for each character
Actual font character width
Text is aligned to the left
Text is aligned in the center

briefdescription.para: LCD alignment enum.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration defines the text alignment. It is used by LCD_bufferPrintxxxAligned functions.

briefdescription.para: LCD page enum.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration defines the LCD pages. It is used by LCD_bufferxxx functions

briefdescription.para: LCD x-axis enum.

detaileddescription.para: This enumeration defines x axis limit It is used for x argument in LCD_bufferxxx functions

briefdescription.para: LCD y-axis enum.

briefdescription.para: LCD Parameters are used to with the LCD_open() call. Default values for these parameters are set using LCD_Params_init().
Format of LCD commands used by the LCD controller.

LCD Object.

detaileddescription.para: The application must not access any member variables of this structure!

briefdescription.para: LCD Hardware attributes.
The LCD_Config structure contains a set of pointers used to characterize the LCD driver implementation.

memberdef.argsstring: (LCD_Handle handle)
memberdef.name: LCD_close

briefdescription.para: Function to close the LCD instance specified by the LCD handle.

simplesect.para: LCD_open() has to be called first. Function assumes that the handle is not NULL. Calling context: Task.

parameterdescription.para: A LCD handle returned from LCD_open()

memberdef.argsstring: (void)
memberdef.name: LCD_init

briefdescription.para: This function initializes the LCD driver module.

simplesect.para: The LCD_config structure must exist and be persistent before this function can be called. This function must be called before any other LCD driver APIs. Calling context: Hwi, Swi, Task, Main.

memberdef.argsstring: (LCD_Buffer *buffers, uint8_t nBuffers, LCD_Params *params)
memberdef.name: LCD_open

briefdescription.para: Function to set up the DOGM128W-6 LCD display.

simplesect.para: LCD controller has been initialized using LCD_init(). Calling context: Task.

parameterdescription.para: Number of buffers in the buffer block.
Pointer to a parameter block, if NULL it will use default values

simplesect.para: A pointer to a LCD_Handle on success or a NULL it was already opened

memberdef.argsstring: (LCD_Params *params)
memberdef.name: LCD_Params_init

briefdescription.para: Function to initialize the LCD_Params struct to its defaults.

simplesect.para: Calling context: Task.

memberdef.argsstring: (LCD_Handle handle, unsigned int bufIndex, char *str, unsigned int uiValue, unsigned char ucFormat, unsigned char ucLine)
memberdef.name: LCD_writeLine

briefdescription.para: Function that writes a string and value to a buffer and sends it to the LCD display. The written page is being cleared before it is written to.

detaileddescription.para: LCD_write will block task execution until all the data in buffer has been written to the LCD.

simplesect.para: Function assumes that the handle and buffer is not NULL. Calling context: Task

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to use, specified by its index in the LCD_Buffer structure.
A pointer to the string to print.
Base of the value to print – 2,8,16 etc. ucFormat must be between 2 and 36, where 10 means decimal base, 16 hexadecimal, 8 octal, and 2 binary. If ucFormat is zero, only the string will get printed.
The page to write. Must be a value from 0-7.

memberdef.argsstring: (LCD_Handle handle, unsigned int bufIndex)
memberdef.name: LCD_update

briefdescription.para: Function that writes the specified buffer to the LCD display.

detaileddescription.para: LCD_update will block task execution until all the data in buffer has been written to the LCD.

simplesect.para: Function assumes that the handle and buffer is not NULL. Calling context: Task.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to use, specified by its index in the LCD_Buffer structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (LCD_Handle handle, unsigned int bufIndex, unsigned char ucXFrom, unsigned char ucXTo, LCD_Page iPageFrom, LCD_Page iPageTo)
memberdef.name: LCD_updatePart

briefdescription.para: Function that sends the specified part of the given buffer to the corresponding part on the LCD. This function assumes ucXFrom <= ucXTo and iPageFrom <= iPageTo. The resolution is given in columns [0127] and pages [07].

detaileddescription.para: LCD_updatePart will block task execution until all the data has been written to the LCD.

simplesect.para: Function assumes that the handle and buffer is not NULL. Calling context: Task.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to use, specified by its index in the LCD_Buffer structure.

The first page to write. Must be one of the following enumerated values:
LCD_PAGE0
LCD_PAGE1
LCD_PAGE2
LCD_PAGE3
LCD_PAGE4
LCD_PAGE5
LCD_PAGE6
LCD_PAGE7

simplesect.para: None

memberdef.argsstring: (LCD_Handle handle, unsigned int bufIndex)
memberdef.name: LCD_bufferClear

simplesect.para: Function assumes that the handle and buffer is not NULL. Calling context: Task.

briefdescription.para: LCD driver implementation for a DOGM128W-6 LCD display.

detaileddescription.para: The LCD header file should be included in an application as follows: #include<ti/mw/lcd/LCDDogm1286.h>

This LCD driver implementation is designed to operate on a DOGM128W-6 LCD display. This display is the one used on the SmartRF06 EB (Evaluation Board). The LCD display can be written to by first writing the data to display to an internal buffer, and then sending the buffer content to the LCD display. The LCD driver will make use of the SPI driver for updating the display. The driver contains different functions for both modifying the internal buffer and for updating the display with the buffer content.

The DOGM128W-6 LCD display contains 128 pixel columns and 64 pixel rows. The (x,y) coordinate system is as described below: * * X -----> * Y +---------------------------------------------+ * | |(0,0) PAGE 0 (127,0)| * | | PAGE 1 | * v | PAGE 2 | * | PAGE 3 | * | PAGE 4 | * | PAGE 5 | * | PAGE 6 | * |(0,63) PAGE 7 (127,63)| * +---------------------------------------------+ *

This LCD driver uses a 5x7 font, thus each character takes up 5 pixels width and 7 pixels height. Each line of text will take up one page of the display. The difference between the defined variables LCD_CHAR_WIDTH and LCD_FONT_WIDTH equals the character spacing on the LCD display.

Before using LCD:
In order to use the DOGM128W-6 LCD display on the SmartRF06 EB, the application needs to first drive the Board_3V3_EN pin high to enable the 3.3V domain on the board.
The LCD display is configured by calling LCD_open(). This function will in turn open the SPI driver and allocate the 2 additional control signals (through the PIN driver) required to operate the LCD.

In total the following pins are required to operate the LCD on the SmartRF06EB: * Board_SPI0_MOSI (Serial peripheral interface, Master-Out-Slave-In, controlled by LCD driver) * Board_SPI0_MISO (Serial peripheral interface, Master-In-Slave-Out, controlled by LCD driver) * Board_SPI0_CLK (Serial peripheral interface, Clock, controlled by LCD driver) * Board_LCD_CSN (Serial peripheral interface, Chip select, controlled by LCD driver) * Board_LCD_RST (LCD reset signal, active low, controlled by LCD driver) * Board_LCD_MODE (LCD mode signal, controlled by LCD driver) * Board_3V3_EN (Enable the 3.3V domain. NOTE: Must be set by application, NOT controlled by LCD driver) *

The following SPI parameters will be fixed by the LCD driver:
transferMode = SPI_MODE_BLOCKING
transferTimeout = BIOS_WAIT_FOREVER
mode = SPI_MASTER
dataSize = 8

The APIs in this driver serve as an interface to a typical TI-RTOS application. The specific peripheral implementations are responsible to create all the SYS/BIOS specific primitives to allow for thread-safe operation.

After LCD operation has ended:
Release system dependencies for LCD by calling LCD_close().
Please refer to the SPI driver documentation for information about error handling during a SPI transaction.
If an error occurs when modifying the internal buffers, the functions are return without completing the buffer modification.

The TI-RTOS power management framework will try to put the device into the most power efficient mode whenever possible. Please see the technical reference manual for further details on each power mode.

The LCD driver makes use of the SPICC26XXDMA driver, which is setting a power constraint during transfers to keep the device out of standby. I.e. device will enter idle mode when no tasks are active. When the transfer has finished, the power constraint is released.

The LCD driver joined (at link time) to an array of LCD_Buffer structures named lcdBuffers. lcdBuffers is implemented in the application with each entry being an instance of a LCD_Buffer. The number of buffers availible must be passed as an argument to LCD_open(). Each entry in lcdBuffers contains a:
(Char *) which points to a buffer with data to be printed on the LCD
(unsigned int) which is the size of the buffer
(SemaphoreP_Struct) which is a semaphore to be associated with the buffer. The Semaphores will be constructed by the LCD driver when it is being opened, and is being used to block task execution while the associated buffer is in use.

para.heading: Modifying internal buffers and updating LCD display

detaileddescription.para: Before the LCD screen can be filled, the data to display must be written to the internal buffers. All functions called LCD_bufferxxxx are only modifying the internal buffers. To send the buffer content to the LCD display, one must use the functions LCD_update() or LCD_updatePart(). The only exception from this is the function LCD_writeLine(), which both modifies a buffer and send the content to the LCD display.

entry.para: API function
Description
Initialize LCD display and configure SPI driver
Disable LCD operation
Write a string and a number to a page on the LCD display
Write the content of a LCD buffer to the display
Write part of a LCD buffer to the display
Empty an entire LCD buffer
Empty an entire page in a LCD buffer
Empty part of a LCD buffer
Invert the pixels of a part of a LCD buffer
Invert the pixels of a page in a LCD buffer
Write a string to a LCD buffer
Write an aligned string to a LCD buffer
Write an integer to a LCD buffer
Write an aligned integer to a LCD buffer
Write a floating point number to a LCD buffer
Write an aligned floating point number to a LCD buffer
Draw a line to a LCD buffer
Clear a line from a LCD buffer
Draw a horizontal line to a LCD buffer
Clear a horizontal line from a LCD buffer
Draw a vertical line to a LCD buffer
Clear a vertical line from a LCD buffer
Draw a horizontal arrow to a LCD buffer
Draw a vertical arrow to a LCD buffer
Set a pixel in a LCD buffer
Clear a pixel in a LCD buffer
Copy content of one LCD buffer into another
Set the contrast of the LCD display

detaileddescription.para: The most basic use cases discribed are described below. A complete LCD example can also be found in the TI-RTOS simplelink distribution.

para.heading: Updating LCD display with buffer content

detaileddescription.para: The LCD driver interface produces log statements if instrumentation is enabled.

entry.para: Diagnostics Mask
Log details
Diags_USER1
basic operations performed
